metadata.title: PML-N sacrifices political interests to rescue PakistanÃ¢ÂÂs economy: Rana Sanaullah

content.article_body: ISLAMABAD, Jan 3 (APP):Special assistant to PM on political affairs Rana Sanaullah Khan Friday stated that the Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) has sacrificed its political interests to rescue Pakistan from default and revive the countryas economy, which was in a state of emergency. In a recent interview with a private news channel, Rana Sanaullah stressed the importance of collective effort to strengthen Pakistanas economy, urging all stakeholders to work together with the government to achieve a better By working together all stakeholders including PTI can pool their resources, expertise and knowledge to drive economic growth and development, he added. In a firm response to PTIas upcoming demands, he declared that Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf will table a aCharter of Demandsa in the next round of talks with the government, adding, once PTI submits its formal, written demands we will convene with our legal experts and deliver a decisive rebuttal. Responding to a question about the military courtas decision on individuals involved in the May 9 incident, Rana Sanaullah commended the Army Chiefas balanced approach. He advised PTI to refrain from making provocative statements, acknowledging that the military has its own system of accountability and justice.
content.summary: Rana Sanaullah Khan stated that the Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) has sacrificed its political interests to rescue Pakistan's economy. He emphasized the need for collective effort from all stakeholders, including PTI, to drive economic growth. Sanaullah also responded to PTI's upcoming demands and the military court's decision on the May 9 incident.
